oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Leslie Satcher - 2017-02-04
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by singer songwriter Leslie Satcher from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on February 4, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Leslie Satcher;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in Music / (04:37) Opening comments from Abi Tapia and introduction of Leslie Satcher / (07:43) Opening comments from Leslie and story about guitar CONFIRM / (09:43) When God-Fearin' Women Get The Blues / (14:03) Tough / (21:51) You Can't Hide Country / (25:18) Story about meeting Willie Nelson for the first time / (29:11) You Remain / (33:12) Question from the audience about her first written songs / (34:40) Question about her career and Vince Gill story / (39:04) Songs she's written that have never been recorded / (41:23) Leslie tells about her musical influences / (44:59) Story about playing the Bluebird Cafe with Vince Gill / (46:47) Unidentified Song possibly titled Two Choices / (50:46) Story about writing the song Troubadour for George Strait / (55:12) Troubadour / (57:34) Closing comments by Leslie / (58:56) Walk-out music / (01:02:01) TAPE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Satcher, Leslie; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
